author: jonny.trafford
title: ADAView - Simplifying Cardano
description: The complexities of Cardano can be daunting to new users who don't understand the intricacies of the UTXO model & staking rewards mechanism

f6_assessments.q0: Thinking back to my earlier cardano interactions, I can definitely see the utility of a tool like this.  I believe the proposer does a reasonable job of defining the problem/solution fit, including why they selected the Miscellaneous challenge.  I'm confident that the overall impact of this project serves to add value by creating an interesting new tool that will strengthen the community of new and experienced users alike.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap presented in the proposal is clear and easy to understand.  The budget is also in line with my experience working on similar projects in the past.  I appreciated that the proposal team's funding request is aimed at expediting development of this tool, and that they were able to post a beta version to indicate their commitment to the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer's expectations of auditability reasonably compliments their open source development model.  And the progress reporting for this project has a high level of accountability due to the fact that a clear, existing roadmap has been presented for project delivery.  This strategy also allows for community collaboration on the project development process, and enough time/flexibility is allowed to incorporate that feedback into the final product.

f6_assessments.q0: Here we have a promising idea for completing work on a tool that could help make the workings of the Cardano blockchain more palatable to regular users. The case for this project, through the example given, is well-argued. It is marvelous to be able to see the tool function in its beta form, which strengthens the case for this proposal considerably by offering us an illustrative vision of what's to come.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap provided would produce results soon and is very reasonable, and the costs are for the labor of the tool development and also reasonable at $10,000. Where I am somewhat concerned is the lack of transparency about the team members. Different participants in the blockchain environment have different levels of tolerance for lack of transparency on personal identity when it comes to investments like this. So I'll simply note that while the team members list their skillsets, we see no names or resumes or links in this area. If this was not an intentional omission, I will recommend that if this proposal goes unfunded this round, that it would be a useful element to update in the next.
f6_assessments.q2: That the team is producing quarterly updates is good news here, because that is a good way for interested community members to audit the progress of the proposal. And since the proposal is for a tool on a public website, it should be simple to monitor.
f6_assessments.reply: I understand your concern, but the reason we can't provide too much clarity on the team members background is due to the nature of our work.  I honestly can't really say too much about our work, other than we are all federal government employees.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tries to create adaview, a site that gives a user-friendly interface and experience of user transactions on the Cardano ecosystem. The team also provide potential risks and reasonable way to overcome them. That is, use up to 3 months between release and use funding appropriately.
f6_assessments.q1: The team already started development in December 2021 and the beta version is on live. The roadmap is clearly explained on the adaview site. The budget information is broken down into details for server, load balancer, developer cost, etc. The proposal provides the background and experience of three developers contributing to the project. However, the team does not give personal information such as names let alone a LinkedIn profile, thus making the community cannot verify the claims. It would be much better if the team also provide LinkedIn profile or any other way to confirm the experience the team has. Other than that, because the ongoing project is successful I believe the team can execute the proposal in a timely manner.
f6_assessments.q2: The project will have a GitHub repository thus making the community easily track the progress of the project. Even though there isn’t a roadmap or timeline on the proposal itself, they attach an adequate roadmap on the adaview site. However, for the success indicators, it needs to be elaborate in a more measurable manner, for example, more than 80% of users considered adaview useful.
f6_assessments.reply: I understand your concern, but the reason we can't provide too much clarity on the team members background is due to the nature of our work.  I honestly can't really say too much about our work, other than we are all federal government employees.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has been written very well. It caught my attention because I think this challenge is a very big one in the Cardano ecosystem. I know a lot of people that would get into crypto/Cardano if they felt more comfortable with what it is. Giving the users a recognizable user interface will be super important. It may help the users feel more comfortable putting their money on this platform since it feels similar to them. I see a great use-case with the project and for that reason, I give this section a 5 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: I agree with the fact that this proposal is going to be implemented successfully. Something that I would add to this proposal that will really get you attention and the funds that are required is to add information about the 3 software developers. If there was a LinkedIn profile, or even just names behind these developers it would propel this proposal to new heights. More people would find this proposal to have significant value. There is a lot of experience behind these developers, it just needs to be verifiable. For this reason I'm giving this section a 3 out of 5 stars until there is a change.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a decent amount of information that will help this proposal to get funded, However, there are still a couple things I would improve. The first thing would be to add more information about the team that will be working on the proposal and 2nd, to make it easier for the CA's to see the roadmap and where the funds will go. Maybe bold these areas or give a brief description of these details at the top and then continue to explain. After these small things have been looked into more, this proposal would be written exquisitely. But as for now, I give this section of the proposal a 3 out of 5 stars.
f6_assessments.reply: I understand your concern, but the reason we can't provide too much clarity on the team members background is due to the nature of our work.  I honestly can't really say too much about our work, other than we are all federal government employees.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge quite effectively and delivers a viable plan by recognizing the initial problems that new users may encounter. The proposal clearly articulate how they would address the problem by creating an API that’s simpler with user friendly interface and accessible additional information, thus providing a bridge that can help new users to comfortably familiarize and navigates themselves around the Cardano space. Therefore, it would eventually lead to an increased amount of adoption of new users into Cardano space.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal seems to have a professional and well-seasoned team, although it would be a favorable addition if they can back up their team credibility & experiences by providing an affiliated link. The budget is clear and well explained with details provided. They also have a realistic timelines and achievable set of goals, This proposal also has a clear ideas on how they would implemented their ideas and to further expanded them.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a straightforward proposal that plans to utilize digital distribution platform such as discord to engage with its community, they also done a great job by providing a clear roadmap on their website. The success of this proposal is clearly defined and easily measured by looking at whether or not the API will be successfully launched and can also be easily tracked through their eventual live version. However, it will be more helpful to further specify the target numbers. Users, in this case, that could be reached through the success of this proposal in order to get a better understanding on the impact it will create.

f6_assessments.q0: Since many Crypto/Cardano views displays unwanted data and there is lot of disturbance when accessing the webs by suddenly getting ads ,or when user is about to click something suddenly ads appears ,later user is navigated to some unwanted page, these kind of disturbance will also create fear in using the dApps or webs, even the user is not able to view his rewards to due to displaying of some unwanted data, so this proposal brings solutions to such issues where the proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Since the proposer wants to create simple ADA view which is not much a difficult job, where he wants to mimic his web similar to banks , these kind of webs are already present and making one more will not be a challenging one.
The proposer's team has already released Beta version for the users to gain the review which is a great achievement.
The proposer's team wants to merge with UTXO based transactions for Rewards based transactions, which is definitely great idea. The proposer team consists of Lead Backend developer and Lead UI developer with experience of more than 20 years, hence with Given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer has introduced his team, which consists of backend, UI developer with more than 20 years of experience each. The proposer has even mentioned about the easiness that will be provided for user to check the data and rewards , the proposer has found the right partner for reward transaction which is UTXO based transactions.
The proposer has clearly mentioned about his beta version provided and further improvements that will be added based on review provided, by providing proper key indicators and clear budget breaking ,the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer aims to provide a familiar contextual view of Cardano to the new users, while providing benefits to experienced users. AdaView is user friendly and provides a more familiar user interface, that is more of an online banking experience. The proposer is adding the ability for users to understand how the network behaves and how they can perform the transactions going through stake registration, or stake delegation, and next transactions. The proposer wants to address the challenge in terms of communicating their project, after the beta stage, through their social media accounts,  and other online Cardano communities. Their tool will be free to use so they will be looking for other projects that will promote their tool as well  and make use of it during their promotions. 
The main risks mentioned is time constraints of the team and also the risk of not being able to implement all desired features. But their solution stated is their commitment to the project.   The challenge is addressed effectively , hence my 4 star rating.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project started in December 2021, and ongoing, they plan two beta releases within 2 months; they plan to have a live Release in late Spring 2022, then quarterly based releases on the feedback they receive and new events and happenings on the Cardano network. 
The budget breakdown shows the purchases of some items mentioned costing some stated amounts. It also states rates per hour. Budget is well broken down in details. 
The team comprises 3 software developers with combined 50 years experiences in real time  operational software, stake pool , etc. 
The information provided makes the proposal likely to be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
Their tracking of events and all issues will be on a discord server and GitHub repository. They will produce quarterly updates with new features inspired by community and Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Their roadmap will be on Adaview site and updated from time to time as they progress. 
Success will be seen as wide use of wallet which is easy introduction to the Cardano network, and also provide a useful tool for experienced users to be able to gain a better understanding of what is happening with their accounts and wallets. 
 This is a new proposal as indicated. 
The information provided is sufficient for successful auditing. 
This proposal is quite laudable because it will help bank the unbanked in the communities and promote Cardano in the long run.

solution: We aim to provide a unified and familiar contextual view of Cardano to the new users, while providing benefit to experienced users.
experience: We are a team of 3 software developers with combined 50 years experience in realtime operational software.  Have been operating the CanadaStakes (CAN1) stake pool for close to a year, and have been actively working in the local community to promote Cardano.
